alert.note: Alert for Grant; Hooker (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 9:03AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Grant and central Hooker Counties through 900 AM MDT... At 802 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of Mullen, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mullen, Carr Lake, Hecla, Highway 97 crossing the Dismal River, Kelso and Weir. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 164 and 189. Highway 97 between mile markers 52 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
